Uses of Package
fast3d.fragment

  • Packages that use fast3d.fragment 
    Package Description
    fast3d.fragment  
    fast3d.simple.fragment  
  • Classes in fast3d.fragment used by fast3d.fragment 
    Class and Description
    FragmentShaderManager
    a fragment shader manager combines all fragment shader threads used to render one frame
  • Classes in fast3d.fragment used by fast3d.simple.fragment 
    Class and Description
    FragmentShader
    a fragment shader is a per pixel shader
    for every pixel in the image (-part) to render it processes once defining it's color
    the render process for the image (-part) is in a separate thread to accelerate the entire render process by split it up into multiple parallel tasks
    a subclasses has to implement all parts of the render process by overriding the shadeFragment() methods and various others
    it is requested to hold the following order:
    shadeFragment(int,int) : arguments are the screen x,y position of the pixel to process shadeFragment(double,double) : arguments are the screen x/width and y/height ratios of the pixel to process shadeFragment(Vector3d,Vector3d) : arguments are the start and direction vector of the ray tracing all renderables of the universe shadeFragment(Hashtable_Renderable_Vector3d) : argument is the collection of all traced renderables by the ray of the previous method shadeFragment(Renderable,Vector3d) : arguments are the closest-to-the-camera renderable (defined over his puncture-point with the ray) calculateCompleteIllumination(Illuminatable,Vector3d) : arguments are the renderable that is illuminatable and its puncture point with the ray calculateIllumination(Illuminatable,Vector3d,Light) : arguments as prior and the light to calculate the illumination and findClosestToTheCam(Hashtable_Renderable_Vector3d) : searches the hashtable for the renderable thats puncture-point is the nearest one to the universes camera position
    FragmentShaderManager
    a fragment shader manager combines all fragment shader threads used to render one frame
